title: Science
description: Learn environmental practices and basic electricity concepts through passages and diagrams for Grade 8 students.

subtopics.title: Eco-Friendly Classroom
subtopics.content:
## Eco-Friendly Classroom

A group of students planned to make their classroom eco-friendly. They decided to plant small indoor plants, replace plastic bottles with steel bottles, and set up a compost bin for food waste. They also checked the classroom's electric wiring and lights to save energy.
subtopics.codeExample:
### Comprehension Questions (Q21-25):
- What steps did students take for eco-friendliness?
- Why replace plastic with steel bottles?
- What is a compost bin used for?
- How to save energy with wiring and lights?
- Why plant indoor plants?

### Practice:
- Identify sustainable practices
- Explain benefits of each action
- Plan your own eco-friendly initiatives

subtopics.title: Simple Electric Circuit
subtopics.content:
## Diagram-Based: Simple Electric Circuit

Observe the free-hand diagram of a simple electric circuit with a switch, bulb, and battery.
subtopics.codeExample:
### Questions (Q26-30):
- Identify components in the circuit
- What happens when switch is ON?
- Role of battery and bulb
- Draw and label similar circuit
- Explain open and closed circuit

### Practice:
- Describe circuit function
- Predict circuit behavior
- Experiment with circuit variations
